info.name: MultiAgentsBeta API Azure
info.description:
API collection for testing MultiAgentsBeta chat functionality with Azure AI Agent integration. Features automatic agentThreadId management for seamless conversation continuity. Updated with new grouped response structure and proper thread deletion:

- tokenUsage: Object containing all token-related information (tokenCount, totalTokenCount, maxTokens, remainingTokens, tokenUsagePercentage)
- session: Object containing session information (agentThreadId, isSessionClosed, sessionMessage)
- Graceful session closure when token limits are exceeded (>100% of advertised limit)
- Users receive their AI response even when session is closed due to token limits
- Proper thread deletion: DELETE /api/agent/threads/{agentThreadId} actually deletes Azure AI Agent threads
- Automatic collection variable management for conversation continuity

request.description:
Start a new conversation with the AI agent. Leave agentThreadId empty or null for a new conversation. Returns:
- message: Agent response content
- role: Message role (Assistant)
- timestamp: Response timestamp
- tokenUsage: Object containing token information (tokenCount, totalTokenCount, maxTokens, remainingTokens, tokenUsagePercentage)
- session: Object containing session information (agentThreadId, isSessionClosed, sessionMessage)
- isError: Boolean indicating if there was an error
- errorType: Type of error if any
- errorMessage: Error message if any

request.description: Example of using the stored Azure AI Agent Thread ID to continue a conversation. The agentThreadId is automatically filled from the collection variable, enabling persistent multi-turn conversations with Azure AI Agent context. Returns the same grouped structure as other chat requests.

Example request to demonstrate the new grouped response structure. When token limits are exceeded, the response will include:
- tokenUsage: Object with tokenCount, totalTokenCount, maxTokens, remainingTokens, tokenUsagePercentage
- session: Object with agentThreadId, isSessionClosed (true when >100%), sessionMessage (explains why session is closed)
- isError: false (even when session is closed, user gets their response)

This shows how the API gracefully handles token limit exceeded by returning the user's response with a session closure message.

item.name: Workflow - Delete Thread After Session Closed

request.description: Demonstrates the complete workflow: when a session is closed due to token limits, use this endpoint to properly delete the Azure AI Agent thread and reset the token session. This provides a clean slate for starting a new conversation. The thread will be permanently deleted from Azure AI Agent.

exec: // Demonstrate the complete thread deletion workflow
console.log("1. Session was closed due to token limit exceeded");
console.log("2. User received their AI response with session closure message");
console.log("3. Thread was properly deleted from Azure AI Agent");
console.log("4. Token session was reset locally");
console.log("5. Ready for a fresh conversation!");
console.log("\n‚ö†Ô∏è  IMPORTANT: The thread has been permanently deleted!");
console.log("You must create a new conversation to continue.");
// Clear the stored agentThreadId since the thread is deleted
console.log("\n‚úÖ Collection variable 'agentThreadId' has been cleared.");
